FuncDef:
The nat64 alarm port-number address-group disable command disables the log and alarm functions of port usage of a NAT64 public IP address pool.
The nat64 alarm port-number user enable command enables the log and alarm functions for NAT64 user port usage.
The undo nat64 alarm port-number address-group disable command restores the default function.
The undo nat64 alarm port-number user enable command disables the log and alarm functions for NAT64 user port usage.
By default, the log and alarm functions of port usage of a NAT64 public IP address pool are enabled, the log and alarm functions for NAT64 user port usage are disabled.
CLIs: nat64 alarm port-number { trap | log } user enable
nat64 alarm port-number { trap | log } address-group disable
undo nat64 alarm port-number { trap | log } user enable
undo nat64 alarm port-number { trap | log } address-group disable

ParaDef.Info:
Enables or disables the alarm function for NAT64 user port usage, or the alarm function of usage of a NO-PAT address pool, or the alarm function of port usage of a NAT64 public IP address pool.
-

Enables or disables the log function for NAT64 user port usage, or the log function of usage of a NO-PAT address pool, or the log function of port usage of a NAT64 public IP address pool.
-

Examples: [*HUAWEI-nat64-instance-nat1] nat64 alarm port-number log user enable
[*HUAWEI-nat64-instance-nat1] nat64 alarm port-number trap user enable
[*HUAWEI-nat64-instance-nat1] nat64 alarm port-number log address-group disable
[*HUAWEI-nat64-instance-nat1] nat64 alarm port-number trap address-group disable
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To monitor NAT64 port usage, run the undo nat64 alarm port-number address-group disable command to enable the log and alarm functions of port usage of a NAT64 public IP address pool. If the number of used or pre-allocated ports in a NAT64 address pool exceeds a specified alarm threshold, a device generates an alarm and records a log.
The log and alarm functions of port usage of a NAT64 public IP address pool are enabled by default. If you do not need to monitor port usage in a NAT64 address pool, run the nat64 alarm port-number address-group disable command to disable the log and alarm functions of port usage of the NAT64 public IP address pool.
To monitor port usage of NAT64 users, run the nat64 alarm port-number user enable command to enable the log and alarm functions for NAT64 user port usage. If the NAT64 user port usage exceeds a specified threshold, a device generates an alarm and records a log.
